title: fix(deps): update kube-rs (kube, kube-runtime, k8s-openapi) (minor)
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [k8s-openapi](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi) | dependencies | minor | `0.19` -> `0.20` |
| [kube](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube) | dependencies | minor | `0.85` -> `0.86` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>Arnavion/k8s-openapi (k8s-openapi)</summary>

### [`v0.20.0`](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v0200-2023-09-07)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/compare/v0.19.0...v0.20.0)

#### k8s-openapi

-   BREAKING CHANGE: This release removes all associated methods of resource types that mapped API operations. For example, there is no more `fn api::core::v1::Pod::list()`, and all types related to API operations like `ListOptional` and `ResponseBody` have also been removed. See [https://github.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/issues/149](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/issues/149) for more details.

-   BREAKING CHANGE: Added support for Kubernetes 1.28 under the `v1_28` feature.

-   BREAKING CHANGE: Dropped support for Kubernetes 1.20 and 1.21.

Corresponding Kubernetes API server versions:

-   v1.22.17
-   v1.23.17
-   v1.24.17
-   v1.25.13
-   v1.26.8
-   v1.27.5
-   v1.28.1

#### k8s-openapi-codegen-common

-   BREAKING CHANGE: `write_operation` and other things related to emitting API operations have been removed.

#### k8s-openapi-derive

-   BREAKING CHANGE: The generated resource type no longer has associated clientset methods for listing etc.

***

</details>

<details>
<summary>kube-rs/kube (kube)</summary>

### [`v0.86.0`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#0860--2023-09-08)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.85.0...0.86.0)

\===================

</details>

fix(deps): update rust crate arboard to 3.2.1
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [arboard](https://togithub.com/1Password/arboard) | dependencies | patch | `3.2.0` -> `3.2.1` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>1Password/arboard (arboard)</summary>

### [`v3.2.1`](https://togithub.com/1Password/arboard/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#321-on-2023-28-11)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/1Password/arboard/compare/v3.2.0...v3.2.1)

##### Fixed

-   Removed all leaks from the macOS clipboard code. Previously, both the `get` and `set` methods leaked data.
-   Fixed documentation examples so that they compile on Linux.
-   Removed extra whitespace macOS's HTML copying template. This caused unexpected behavior in some apps.

##### Changed

-   Added a timeout when connecting to the X11 server on UNIX platforms. In situations where the X11 socket is present but unusable, the clipboard
    initialization will no longer hang indefinitely.
-   Removed macOS-specific dependency on the `once_cell` crate.

</details>

title: fix(deps): update rust crate ratatui to 0.23.0
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [ratatui](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui) | dependencies | minor | `0.22.0` -> `0.23.0` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>ratatui-org/ratatui (ratatui)</summary>

### [`v0.23.0`](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v0230---2023-08-28)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/compare/v0.22.0...v0.23.0)

We are thrilled to release the new version of `ratatui` 🐭, the official successor[\*](https://togithub.com/fdehau/tui-rs/commit/335f5a4563342f9a4ee19e2462059e1159dcbf25) of [`tui-rs`](https://togithub.com/fdehau/tui-rs).

In this version, we improved the existing widgets such as `Barchart` and `Scrollbar`. We also made improvmements in the testing/internal APIs to provide a smoother testing/development experience. Additionally, we have addressed various bugs and implemented enhancements.

Here is a blog post that highlights the new features and breaking changes along with a retrospective about the project: <https://blog.orhun.dev/ratatui-0-23-0>

##### Features

-   *(barchart)* Add direction attribute. (horizontal bars support) ([#​325](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/325))
    ([0dca6a6](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/0dca6a689a7af640c5de8f7c87c2f1e03f0adf25))

    ```text
    * feat(barchart): Add direction attribute

    Enable rendering the bars horizontally. In some cases this allow us to
    make more efficient use of the available space.
    ```

-   *(cell)* Add voluntary skipping capability for sixel ([#​215](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/215))
    ([e4bcf78](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/e4bcf78afabe6b06970c51b4284246e345002cf5))

    ```text
    > Sixel is a bitmap graphics format supported by terminals.
    > "Sixel mode" is entered by sending the sequence ESC+Pq.
    > The "String Terminator" sequence ESC+\ exits the mode.

    The graphics are then rendered with the top left positioned at the
    cursor position.

    It is actually possible to render sixels in ratatui with just
    `buf.get_mut(x, y).set_symbol("^[Pq ... ^[\")`. But any buffer covering
    the "image area" will overwrite the graphics. This is most likely the same
    buffer, even though it consists of empty characters `' '`, except for
    the top-left character that starts the sequence.

    Thus, either the buffer or cells must be specialized to avoid drawing
    over the graphics. This patch specializes the `Cell` with a
    `set_skip(bool)` method, based on James' patch:
    https://github.com/TurtleTheSeaHobo/tui-rs/tree/sixel-support
    I unsuccessfully tried specializing the `Buffer`, but as far as I can tell
    buffers get merged all the way "up" and thus skipping must be set on the
    Cells. Otherwise some kind of "skipping area" state would be required,
    which I think is too complicated.

    Having access to the buffer now it is possible to skip all cells but the
    first one which can then `set_symbol(sixel)`. It is up to the user to
    deal with the graphics size and buffer area size. It is possible to get
    the terminal's font size in pixels with a syscall.

    An image widget for ratatui that uses this `skip` flag is available at
    https://github.com/benjajaja/ratatu-image.
    ```

-   *(list)* Add option to always allocate the "selection" column width ([#​394](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/394))
    ([4d70169](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/4d70169bef86898d331f46013ff72ef6d1c275ed))

    ```text
    * feat(list): add option to always allocate the "selection" column width

    Before this option was available, selecting a item in a list when nothing was selected
    previously made the row layout change (the same applies to unselecting) by adding the width
    of the "highlight symbol" in the front of the list, this option allows to configure this
    behavior.

    * style: change "highlight_spacing" doc comment to use inline code-block for reference
    ```

-   *(release)* Add automated nightly releases ([#​359](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/359))
    ([aad164a](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/aad164a5311b0a6d6d3f752a87ed385d5f0c1962))

    ```text
    * feat(release): add automated nightly releases

    * refactor(release): rename the alpha workflow

    * refactor(release): simplify the release calculation
    ```

-   *(scrollbar)* Add optional track symbol ([#​360](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/360))
    ([1727fa5](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/1727fa5120fa4bfcddd57484e532b2d5da88bc73)) \[**breaking**]

    ```text
    The track symbol is now optional, simplifying composition with other
    widgets.
    ```

-   *(table)* Add support for line alignment in the table widget ([#​392](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/392))
    ([7748720](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/77487209634f26da32bc59d9280769d80cc7c25c))

    ```text
    * feat(table): enforce line alignment in table render

    * test(table): add table alignment render test
    ```

-   *(widgets::table)* Add option to always allocate the "selection" constraint ([#​375](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/375))
    ([f63ac72](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/f63ac72305f80062727d81996f9bdb523e666099))

    ```text
    * feat(table): add option to configure selection layout changes

    Before this option was available, selecting a row in the table when no row was selected
    previously made the tables layout change (the same applies to unselecting) by adding the width
    of the "highlight symbol" in the front of the first column, this option allows to configure this
    behavior.

    * refactor(table): refactor "get_columns_widths" to return (x, width)

    and "render" to make use of that

    * refactor(table): refactor "get_columns_widths" to take in a selection_width instead of a boolean

    also refactor "render" to make use of this change

    * fix(table): rename "highlight_set_selection_space" to "highlight_spacing"

    * style(table): apply doc-comment suggestions from code review
    ```

-   *(uncategorized)* Expand serde attributes for `TestBuffer` ([#​389](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/389))
    ([57ea871](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/57ea871753a5b23f302c6f0a83d98f6a1988abfb))

-   *(uncategorized)* Add weak constraints to make rects closer to each other in size ✨ ([#​395](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/395))
    ([6153371](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/61533712be57f3921217a905618b319975f90330))

    ```text
    Also make `Max` and `Min` constraints MEDIUM strength for higher priority over equal chunks
    ```

-   *(uncategorized)* Simplify split function ✨ ([#​411](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/411))
    ([b090101](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/b090101b231a467628c910f05a73715809cb8d73))

##### Bug Fixes

-   *(barchart)* Empty groups causes panic ([#​333](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/333))
    ([9c95673](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/9c956733f740b18616974e2c7d786ca761666f79))

    ```text
    This unlikely to happen, since nobody wants to add an empty group.
    Even we fix the panic, things will not render correctly.
    So it is better to just not add them to the BarChart.
    ```

-   *(block)* Fixed title_style not rendered ([#​349](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/349)) ([#​363](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/363))
    ([49a82e0](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/49a82e062f2c46dc3060cdfdb230b65d9dbfb2d9))

-   *(cargo)* Adjust minimum paste version ([#​348](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/348))
    ([8db9fb4](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/8db9fb4aebd01e5ddc4edd68482361928f7e9c97))

    ```text
    ratatui is using features that are currently only available in paste 1.0.2; specifying the minimum version to be 1.0 will consequently cause a compilation error if cargo is only able to use a version less than 1.0.2.
    ```

-   *(example)* Fix typo ([#​337](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/337))
    ([daf5890](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/daf589015290ac8b379389d29ef90a1af15e3f75))

    ```text
    the existential feels
    ```

-   *(layout)* Don't leave gaps between chunks ([#​408](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/408))
    ([56455e0](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/56455e0fee57616f87ea43872fb7d5d9bb14aff5))

    ```text
    Previously the layout used the floor of the calculated start and width
    as the value to use for the split Rects. This resulted in gaps between
    the split rects.

    This change modifies the layout to round to the nearest column instead
    of taking the floor of the start and width. This results in the start
    and end of each rect being rounded the same way and being strictly
    adjacent without gaps.

    Because there is a required constraint that ensures that the last end is
    equal to the area end, there is no longer the need to fixup the last
    item width when the fill (as e.g. width = x.99 now rounds to x+1 not x).

    The colors example has been updated to use Ratio(1, 8) instead of
    Percentage(13), as this now renders without gaps for all possible sizes,
    whereas previously it would have left odd gaps between columns.
    ```

-   *(layout)* Ensure left <= right ([#​410](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/410))
    ([f4ed3b7](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/f4ed3b758450ef9c257705f3a1ea937329a968b4))

    ```text
    The recent refactor missed the positive width constraint
    ```

-   *(readme)* Fix typo in readme ([#​344](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/344))
    ([d05ab6f](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/d05ab6fb700527f0e062f334c7a5319c07099b04))

-   *(readme)* Fix incorrect template link ([#​338](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/338))
    ([b9290b3](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/b9290b35d13df57726d65a16d3c8bb18ce43e8c2))

-   *(readme)* Fix typo in readme ([#​336](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/336))
    ([7e37a96](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/7e37a96678440bc62cce52de840fef82eed58dd8))

-   *(release)* Fix the last tag retrieval for alpha releases ([#​416](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/416))
    ([b6b2da5](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/b6b2da5eb761ac5894cc7a2ee67f422312b63cfc))

-   *(release)* Set the correct permissions for creating alpha releases ([#​400](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/400))
    ([778c320](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/778c32000815b9abb0246c73997b1800256aade2))

-   *(scrollbar)* Move symbols to symbols module ([#​330](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/330))
    ([7539f77](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/commit/7539f775fef4d816495e1e06732f6500cf08c126)) \[**breaking**]

    ```text
    The symbols and sets are moved from `widgets::scrollbar` to
    `symbols::scrollbar`. This makes it consistent with the other symbol
    sets and allows us to make the scrollbar module private rather than
    re-exporting it.
    ```

-   *(table)* Fix unit tests broken due to rounding ([#​419](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/419))

body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [crossterm](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm) | dependencies | minor | `0.26.1` -> `0.27.0` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>crossterm-rs/crossterm (crossterm)</summary>

### [`v0.27.0`](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/releases/tag/0.27.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/compare/0.26.1...0.27.0)

### Version 0.27

#### Added ⭐

-   Add `NO_COLOR` support (https://no-color.org/)
-   Add option to force overwrite `NO_COLOR` ([#​802](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/issues/802))
-   Add support for scroll left/right events on windows and unix systems ([#​788](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/issues/788)).
-   Add `window_size` function to fetch pixel width/height of screen for more sophisticated rendering in terminals.
-   Add support for deserializing hex color strings to \`Color\`\` e.g #fffff.

#### Changes

-   Make the events module an optional feature `events` (to make crossterm more lightweight) ([#​776](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/issues/776))

#### Breaking ⚠️

-   Set minimum rustc version to 1.58 ([#​798](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/issues/798))
-   Change all error types to `std::io::Result` ([#​765](https://togithub.com/crossterm-rs/crossterm/issues/765))

[@​Gronis](https://togithub.com/Gronis), [@​kevin-vigor](https://togithub.com/kevin-vigor), [@​Wilfred](https://togithub.com/Wilfred), [@​benjajaja](https://togithub.com/benjajaja), [@​blt-r](https://togithub.com/blt-r), [@​Piturnah](https://togithub.com/Piturnah), [@​kdheepak](https://togithub.com/kdheepak), [@​DeathVenom54](https://togithub.com/DeathVenom54), [@​senekor](https://togithub.com/senekor), [@​joseluis](https://togithub.com/joseluis), [@​gibbz00](https://togithub.com/gibbz00), [@​lesleyrs](https://togithub.com/lesleyrs), [@​jhartzell42](https://togithub.com/jhartzell42)

</details>

### [`v0.19.0`](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v0190-2023-08-05)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/compare/v0.18.0...v0.19.0)

#### k8s-openapi

-   BREAKING CHANGE: Added support for Kubernetes 1.27 under the `v1_27` feature.

-   FEATURE: The `k8s-openapi` now has two additional Cargo features `earliest` and `latest`, which select the earliest and latest supported version. For example, in this release, `earliest` is equivalent to `v1_20` and `latest` is equivalent to `v1_27`.

Corresponding Kubernetes API server versions:

-   v1.20.15
-   v1.21.14
-   v1.22.17
-   v1.23.17
-   v1.24.16
-   v1.25.12
-   v1.26.7
-   v1.27.4

#### k8s-openapi-codegen-common

-   No changes.

#### k8s-openapi-derive

-   No changes.

***

</details>

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>tui-rs-revival/ratatui (ratatui)</summary>

### [`v0.22.0`](https://togithub.com/tui-rs-revival/ratatui/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v0220---2023-07-17)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/tui-rs-revival/ratatui/compare/v0.21.0...v0.22.0)

##### Features

-   *(barchart)* Set custom text value in the bar ([#​309](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/309))
-   *(barchart)* Enable barchart groups ([#​288](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/288))
-   *(block)* Support for having more than one title ([#​232](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/232))
-   *(examples)* User_input example cursor movement ([#​302](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/302))
-   *(misc)* Make builder fn const ([#​275](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/275)) ([#​275](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/275))
-   *(prelude)* Add a prelude ([#​304](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/304))
-   *(style)* Enable setting the underline color for crossterm ([#​308](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/308)) ([#​310](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/310))
-   *(style)* Allow Modifiers add/remove in const ([#​287](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/287))
-   *(stylize)* Allow all widgets to be styled ([#​289](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/289))
-   *(terminal)* Expose 'swap_buffers' method
-   *(uncategorized)* Stylization shorthands ([#​283](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/283))
-   *(uncategorized)* Add scrollbar widget ([#​228](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/228))

##### Bug Fixes

-   *(clippy)* Unused_mut lint for layout ([#​285](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/285))
-   *(examples)* Correct progress label in gague example ([#​263](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/263))
-   *(layout)* Cap Constraint::apply to 100% length ([#​264](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/264))
-   *(lint)* Suspicious_double_ref_op is new in 1.71 ([#​311](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/311))
-   *(prelude)* Remove widgets module from prelude ([#​317](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/317))
-   *(title)* Remove default alignment and position ([#​323](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/323))
-   *(typos)* Configure typos linter ([#​233](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/233))
-   *(uncategorized)* Rust-tui-template became a revival project ([#​320](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/320))
-   *(uncategorized)* Revert removal of WTFPL from deny.toml ([#​266](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/266))

##### Refactor

-   *(ci)* Simplify cargo-make installation ([#​240](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/240))
-   *(text)* Simplify reflow implementation ([#​290](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/290))

##### Documentation

-   *(color)* Parse more color formats and add docs ([#​306](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/306))
-   *(lib)* Add `tui-term` a pseudoterminal library ([#​268](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/268))
-   *(lib)* Fixup tui refs in widgets/mod.rs ([#​216](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/216))
-   *(lib)* Add backend docs ([#​213](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/213))
-   *(readme)* Remove duplicated mention of tui-rs-tree-widgets ([#​223](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/223))
-   *(uncategorized)* Improve CONTRIBUTING.md ([#​277](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/277))
-   *(uncategorized)* Fix scrollbar ascii illustrations and calendar doc paths ([#​272](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/272))
-   *(uncategorized)* README tweaks ([#​225](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/225))
-   *(uncategorized)* Add CODEOWNERS file ([#​212](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/212))
-   *(uncategorized)* Update README.md and add hello_world example ([#​204](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/204))

##### Styling

-   *(comments)* Set comment length to wrap at 100 chars ([#​218](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/218))
-   *(config)* Apply formatting to config files ([#​238](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/238))

-   *(widget)* Inline format arguments ([#​279](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/279))
-   *(uncategorized)* Fix formatting ([#​292](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/292))

-   *(uncategorized)* Add benchmarks for paragraph ([#​262](https://togithub.com/ratatui-org/ratatui/issues/262))

title: fix(deps): update rust crate kube to 0.84
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [kube](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube) | dependencies | minor | `0.83` -> `0.84` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>kube-rs/kube (kube)</summary>

### [`v0.84.0`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#0840--2023-07-14)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.83.0...0.84.0)

\===================

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.84.0 -->

#### Highlights

##### Stream Improvements

On the `runtime` side, the `Controller` now delays reconciles until the main `Store` is ready (via a [new `Store` helper](https://docs.rs/kube/0.84.0/kube/runtime/reflector/struct.Store.html#method.wait_until_ready) from [#​1243](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1243)). The stream selection for owned resources is more efficient ([#​1240](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1240)), and the underlying `watcher` streams now all paginate ([#​1249](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1249)). There are also many new  [`WatchStreamExt`](https://docs.rs/kube/0.84.0/kube/runtime/trait.WatchStreamExt.html) helpers ( [#​1246](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1246) + [#​1228](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1228) + [#​1232](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1232)) as a continued work towards the more customisable streams-api ([#​1080](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1080)).

On the client-side; streaming logs are now easier to deal with as an `AsyncBufRead` [#​1235](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1235).

##### OIDC Refresh

Optional OIDC refreshable token support was introduced in [#​1229](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1229) under `kube/oidc` for out-of-cluster `Client` configuration. Previously, refresh support was limited to non-OIDC tokens from the `GcpOuth` provider (`kube/oauth`) or through arbitrary `exec` calls / `TokenFile` loading.

#### What's Changed

##### Added

-   Add `Predicate` trait to allow combination + fallbacks by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1228](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1228)
-   Added refreshing OIDC ID token as an optional feature by [@​Razz4780](https://togithub.com/Razz4780) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1229](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1229)
-   Add `WatchStreamExt::default_backoff` shorthand by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1232](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1232)
-   Derive `PartialEq` on `core` params structs by [@​danrspencer](https://togithub.com/danrspencer) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1237](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1237)
-   Track store readiness by [@​nightkr](https://togithub.com/nightkr) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1243](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1243)
-   Add `WatchStreamExt::modify()` to modify events by [@​aryan9600](https://togithub.com/aryan9600) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1246](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1246)
-   Add default pagination to `watcher` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1249](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1249)

##### Changed

-   Bump MSRV from 1.63 to 1.64 by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1233](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1233)
-   Change `Api::log_stream` to return `AsyncBufRead` by [@​aryan9600](https://togithub.com/aryan9600) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1235](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1235)

##### Fixed

-   Make `Controller::owns` use `metadata_watcher` internally by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1240](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1240)

</details>

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.2...0.83.0)

\===================

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.83.0 -->

#### What's Changed

##### Added

-   Add `Controller::reconcile_on` by [@​co42](https://togithub.com/co42) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1163](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1163)
-   Add `predicates::resource_version` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1221](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1221)
-   add `Duration` to `kube-core` by [@​hawkw](https://togithub.com/hawkw) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1224](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1224)

##### Changed

-   Introduce `GetParams` support by [@​mateiidavid](https://togithub.com/mateiidavid) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1214](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1214)

##### Fixed

-   Swap `validator` for `garde` by [@​mateiidavid](https://togithub.com/mateiidavid) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1212](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1212)
-   fix: `#[kube(crates(serde = "some_crate::serde"))]` was not working by [@​chubei](https://togithub.com/chubei) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1215](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1215)

### [`v0.82.2`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0822-httpsgithubcomkube-rskubereleasestag0822--2023-04-19)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.1...0.82.2)

\===================

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.82.2 -->

#### Watcher Fixes

Two fixes to allow `watcher::Config` to function as intended.

#### What's Changed

##### Fixed

-   `runtime::watcher`: only set rv if semantic is any by [@​goenning](https://togithub.com/goenning) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1204](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1204)
-   `watcher::Config`: Derive `Clone` + `Debug` + `PartialEq` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1206](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1206)

### [`v0.82.1`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/releases/tag/0.82.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.0...0.82.1)

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.82.1 -->

#### Bugfix Release

[`nullable`](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/extend-kubernetes/custom-resources/custom-resource-definitions/#defaulting-and-nullable) is re-instated on `Option` types from [`CustomResource`](https://docs.rs/kube/latest/kube/derive.CustomResource.html) generated schemas, due to unintended errors removing it caused on `Api::patch` calls on `None` members that were not setting [`#[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]`](https://serde.rs/attr-skip-serializing.html). This only affected 0.81 and 0.82 from last week, and does not require user action regardless of where you are upgrading from.

This release also fixes a [`metadata_watcher`](https://docs.rs/kube/latest/kube/runtime/fn.metadata_watcher.html) triggering deserialization error from doing `Api::list_metadata` on an empty set.

#### What's Changed

##### Fixed

-   Fix `WatchParams` bookmarks for `watch_metadata` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1193](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1193)
-   Fix `ObjectList` not deserializing `items: null` by [@​suryapandian](https://togithub.com/suryapandian) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1199](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1199)
-   Revert "kube-derive: Disable `option_nullable` for CRD generation" by [@​Dav1dde](https://togithub.com/Dav1dde) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1201](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1201)

#### New Contributors

-   [@​krisnova](https://togithub.com/krisnova) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1198](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1198)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.0...0.82.1

</details>

title: fix(deps): update kube-rs (kube, kube-runtime, k8s-openapi) (minor)
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [k8s-openapi](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi) | dependencies | minor | `0.17` -> `0.18` |
| [kube](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube) | dependencies | minor | `0.80` -> `0.82` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>Arnavion/k8s-openapi</summary>

### [`v0.18.0`](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v0180-2023-04-07)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/compare/v0.17.0...v0.18.0)

#### k8s-openapi

-   BREAKING CHANGE: The `k8s_openapi::DeepMerge` trait and its impls on this crate's types now have semantics in line with merge strategies in Kubernetes. Specifically, the code generator now takes the `x-kubernetes-list-map-keys`, `x-kubernetes-list-type`, `x-kubernetes-map-type`, `x-kubernetes-patch-merge-key` and `x-kubernetes-patch-strategy` annotations into account when generating the `DeepMerge` impls.

    For example, in v0.17.0, `PodSpec::merge_from` would append entries into `self.containers`, whereas now it does a "list-map" strategy to replace containers with the same `name`.

Corresponding Kubernetes API server versions:

-   v1.20.15
-   v1.21.14
-   v1.22.17
-   v1.23.17
-   v1.24.12
-   v1.25.8
-   v1.26.3

#### k8s-openapi-codegen-common

-   BREAKING CHANGE: As mentioned above, the generated code for `k8s_openapi::DeepMerge` impls now takes merge strategy annotations into account.

#### k8s-openapi-derive

-   No changes.

***

</details>

<details>
<summary>kube-rs/kube</summary>

### [`v0.82.2`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0822-httpsgithubcomkube-rskubereleasestag0822--2023-04-19)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.1...0.82.2)

\===================

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.82.2 -->

#### Watcher Fixes

Two fixes to allow `watcher::Config` to function as intended.

#### What's Changed

##### Fixed

-   `runtime::watcher`: only set rv if semantic is any by [@​goenning](https://togithub.com/goenning) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1204](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1204)
-   `watcher::Config`: Derive `Clone` + `Debug` + `PartialEq` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1206](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1206)

### [`v0.82.1`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/releases/tag/0.82.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.0...0.82.1)

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.82.1 -->

#### Bugfix Release

[`nullable`](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/extend-kubernetes/custom-resources/custom-resource-definitions/#defaulting-and-nullable) is re-instated on `Option` types from [`CustomResource`](https://docs.rs/kube/latest/kube/derive.CustomResource.html) generated schemas, due to unintended errors removing it caused on `Api::patch` calls on `None` members that were not setting [`#[serde(skip_serializing_if = "Option::is_none")]`](https://serde.rs/attr-skip-serializing.html). This only affected 0.81 and 0.82 from last week, and does not require user action regardless of where you are upgrading from.

This release also fixes a [`metadata_watcher`](https://docs.rs/kube/latest/kube/runtime/fn.metadata_watcher.html) triggering deserialization error from doing `Api::list_metadata` on an empty set.

#### What's Changed

##### Fixed

-   Fix `WatchParams` bookmarks for `watch_metadata` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1193](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1193)
-   Fix `ObjectList` not deserializing `items: null` by [@​suryapandian](https://togithub.com/suryapandian) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1199](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1199)
-   Revert "kube-derive: Disable `option_nullable` for CRD generation" by [@​Dav1dde](https://togithub.com/Dav1dde) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1201](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1201)

#### New Contributors

-   [@​krisnova](https://togithub.com/krisnova) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1198](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1198)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.82.0...0.82.1

### [`v0.82.0`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0820-httpsgithubcomkube-rskubereleasestag0820--2023-04-08)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.81.0...0.82.0)

\===================

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.82.0 -->

#### Dependency Updates

This release brings in the new [`k8s-openapi` release](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/releases/tag/v0.18.0).
Be sure to upgrade `k8s-openapi` and `kube` **simultaneously** to avoid multiple version errors:

```sh
cargo upgrade -p k8s-openapi -p kube -i
```

#### What's Changed

##### Changed

-   Bump `serde_yaml` to 0.9 by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1188](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1188)
-   Bump `k8s-openapi` to 0.18.0 by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1190](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1190)

### [`v0.81.0`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/releases/tag/0.81.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.80.0...0.81.0)

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.81.0 -->

#### Highlights

##### List/Watch Changes

One big change is the splitting of `ListParams` into `ListParams` and `WatchParams` in [#​1162](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1162) and [#​1171](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1171). If you were using `api.list` directly, this should not affect you, but `api.watch` calls will need a replace of `ListParams` to `WatchParams`. Apart from the resulting field splitting, the two structs still have a mostly compatible api.

If you were passing `ListParams` to `watcher` or `Controller`, you can change this for a new `watcher::Config` with a mostly compatible interface:

```diff
-    let stream = watcher(api, ListParams::default());
+    let stream = watcher(api, watcher::Config::default());
```

The reason for this change has been to add support for specific [version match strategies](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/api-concepts/#semantics-for-get-and-list) and has new builders on both `ListParams` and `watcher::Config` to control the strategy. Using the new `VersionMatch::NotOlderThan` can reduce strain on the apiserver for individual `api.list` calls. Watchers will benefit the most from this, and **should consider** using the semantic `Any` strategy (= `NotOlderThan` with version "0") on all relists by setting `watcher::Config::any_semantic()`.

##### rustls

This release closes [all our rustls issues](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/labels/rustls) as a consequence of the long standing IP address incompatibility ([#​153](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/153)) having been resolved upstream. All `rustls` specific overrides (such as using the deprecated `incluster_dns` strategy for configuration [#​1184](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1184)) have been removed as a result.

##### Controller streams

Multiple new `runtime` features have been added to be able to more precisely control the input streams used by `Controller` a starting step towards stream sharing ([#​1080](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/issues/1080)) and as a way to reduce excess input events. Because these interfaces are likely to remain in flux for some time, these are only available under [unstable feature flags](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/main/kube-runtime/Cargo.toml#L17-L21).

#### What's Changed

##### Added

-   Add `predicates` to allow filtering `watcher` streams by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/911](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/911)
-   Add `Controller::owns_stream` by [@​Dav1dde](https://togithub.com/Dav1dde) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1173](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1173)
-   Add `Controller::for_stream` + `Controller::watches_stream` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1187](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1187)

##### Changed

-   Split `ListParams` and `WatchParams` by [@​nabokihms](https://togithub.com/nabokihms) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1162](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1162)
-   Make `VersionMatch` follow upstream + configure list semantics in `watcher::Config` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1171](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1171)
-   kube-derive: Disable `option_nullable` for CRD generation by [@​Dav1dde](https://togithub.com/Dav1dde) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1079](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1079)

##### Fixed

-   Run `rustls` CI against IP cluster address by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1183](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1183)
-   Fix:  tower buffer's worker closed unexpectedly by [@​divinerapier](https://togithub.com/divinerapier) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1185](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1185)
-   Avoid special `Config::incluster` behavior for `rustls` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1184](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1184)

#### New Contributors

-   [@​nabokihms](https://togithub.com/nabokihms) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1162](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1162)
-   [@​divinerapier](https://togithub.com/divinerapier) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1185](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1185)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.80.0...0.81.0

</details>

title: fix(deps): update rust crate rayon to 1.7
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [rayon](https://togithub.com/rayon-rs/rayon) | dependencies | minor | `1.6` -> `1.7` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rayon-rs/rayon</summary>

### [`v1.7.0`](https://togithub.com/rayon-rs/rayon/blob/HEAD/RELEASES.md#Release-rayon-170--rayon-core-1110-2023-03-03)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rayon-rs/rayon/compare/v1.6.1...v1.7.0)

-   The minimum supported `rustc` is now 1.59.
-   Added a fallback when threading is unsupported.
-   The new `ParallelIterator::take_any` and `skip_any` methods work like
    unordered `IndexedParallelIterator::take` and `skip`, counting items in
    whatever order they are visited in parallel.
-   The new `ParallelIterator::take_any_while` and `skip_any_while` methods work
    like unordered `Iterator::take_while` and `skip_while`, which previously had
    no parallel equivalent. The "while" condition may be satisfied from anywhere
    in the parallel iterator, affecting all future items regardless of position.
-   The new `yield_now` and `yield_local` functions will cooperatively yield
    execution to Rayon, either trying to execute pending work from the entire
    pool or from just the local deques of the current thread, respectively.

### [`v1.6.1`](https://togithub.com/rayon-rs/rayon/blob/HEAD/RELEASES.md#Release-rayon-161-2022-12-09)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rayon-rs/rayon/compare/v1.6.0...v1.6.1)

-   Simplified `par_bridge` to only pull one item at a time from the iterator,
    without batching. Threads that are waiting for iterator items will now block
    appropriately rather than spinning CPU. (Thanks [@​njaard](https://togithub.com/njaard)!)
-   Added protection against recursion in `par_bridge`, so iterators that also
    invoke rayon will not cause mutex recursion deadlocks.

</details>

title: fix(deps): update kube-rs (kube, kube-runtime, k8s-openapi) (minor)
body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [k8s-openapi](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi) | dependencies | minor | `0.16` -> `0.17` |
| [kube](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube) | dependencies | minor | `0.77` -> `0.78` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>Arnavion/k8s-openapi</summary>

### [`v0.17.0`](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#v0170-2023-01-04)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/compare/v0.16.0...v0.17.0)

#### k8s-openapi

-   BREAKING CHANGE: Added support for Kubernetes 1.26 under the `v1_26` feature.

-   BREAKING CHANGE: Dropped support for Kubernetes 1.18 and 1.19.

-   FEATURE: Allow deserializing non-optional `ByteString`s from JSON `null`. The API server is known to allow these `null`s in the `ConfigMap::binary_data` and `Secret::data` maps. The deserialization results in an empty `ByteString`, to match the behavior of the API server when given a `null` value in the `ConfigMap::data` map.

Corresponding Kubernetes API server versions:

-   v1.20.15
-   v1.21.14
-   v1.22.17
-   v1.23.15
-   v1.24.9
-   v1.25.5
-   v1.26.0

</details>

<details>
<summary>kube-rs/kube</summary>

### [`v0.78.0`](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0780-httpsgithubcomkube-rskubereleasestag0780--2023-01-06)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/compare/0.77.0...0.78.0)

\===================

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at 0.78.0 -->

#### Kubernetes Bump

This release brings in the new [`k8s-openapi` release](https://togithub.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/releases/tag/v0.17.0) for `1.26` structs, and sets our [MK8SV](https://kube.rs/kubernetes-version/) to `1.21`.
Be sure to upgrade `k8s-openapi` and `kube` **simultaneously** to avoid multiple version errors:

```sh
cargo upgrade -p k8s-openapi -p kube -i
```

#### What's Changed

##### Added

-   reflector: add helper function to the `Store` by [@​eliad-wiz](https://togithub.com/eliad-wiz) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1111](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1111)

##### Changed

-   Bump `k8s-openapi@0.17.0` and MK8SV by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1116](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1116)

##### Removed

-   Remove deprecated `Config::timeout` by [@​clux](https://togithub.com/clux) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1113](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1113)

##### Fixed

-   fix shell exec exiting message loop when terminalSizeReceiver is dropped by [@​erebe](https://togithub.com/erebe) in [https://github.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1112](https://togithub.com/kube-rs/kube/pull/1112)

</details>
